Art. 4.172. 
Conventional right of return 
The donor may stipulate the right of return of the property given, either in the event of the predecease of the donee alone, or in the event of the predecease of the donee and his descendants.
This right may only be stipulated in favour of the donor alone.
The effect of the right of return is to annul all disposals of the property given, and to return the property to the donor, free of all encumbrances and mortgages.
